title: Indonesia makes former president Soeharto posthumous national hero
summary: Activists condemn award by ex-son-in-law President Subianto, branding it betrayal of Soeharto's victims and democracy.

title: Hundreds protest against air pollution in New Delhi
summary: Hundreds of protesters gathered to demand government action on the worsening air quality and pollution in New Delhi.

title: Philippines assesses damage after deadly Typhoon Fung-wong
summary: Powerful storm set off floods and landslides, killing at least two and displacing 1.4 million .

title: Where Amazon meets ocean: A Brazilian community fights rising tides
summary: Climate change reshapes Vila do Pesqueiro as families adapt to surging tides, erosion, and loss of ancestral homes.

title: Barcelona punish Madrid draw after Lewandowski hat-trick crushes Celta Vigo
summary: Robert Lewandowski's treble against Celta Vigo allowed Barcelona to narrow the gap to Real Madrid on La Liga ladder.

title: Live: Israeli air raids hit Gaza City, southern Lebanon
summary: Israeli air raids target eastern areas of Gaza City while an Israeli drone hits a vehicle in southern Lebanon.

title: Lenny Wilkens, legendary NBA player and coach, dies at 88
summary: Wilkens' family announced the news but did not divulge a cause of death of the Basketball Hall of Fame player and coach.

title: South Korea indicts ex-leader Yoon on charges of aiding the enemy
summary: Yoon Suk Yeol ordered drone flights over North Korea to create pretext for martial law, prosecutors allege.

title: Norris wins Brazil GP to extend F1 championship lead over Piastri
summary: Lando Norris increased his championship points lead over McLaren teammate Oscar Piastri with three races remaining.

title: US Senate takes first step toward ending 40-day government shutdown
summary: Eight Democrats break rank and back deal to reopen government after longest shutdown in US history.

title: Airlines cancel 3,300 US flights amid fears travel could ‘slow to trickle’
summary: US senators reach stopgap deal to end government shutdown, raising hopes for end to six-week-long impasse.

title: US Senate reaches deal to end longest government shutdown
summary: Some Democrats agree to reopen government without a guaranteed extension of healthcare subsidies.

title: Le président syrien arrive aux Etats-Unis pour une visite inédite
summary: Le président intérimaire syrien, Ahmad al-Chareh, est arrivé aux Etats-Unis samedi pour une visite officielle inédite, a rapporté l'agence de presse officielle de son pays, au lendemain de son retrait de la liste noire américaine du terrorisme.

title: Irak : vote anticipé des forces de sécurité pour les législatives du 11 novembre
summary: Marie-Charlotte Roupie, notre correspondante à Bagdad, décrypte la situation.

title: Sécheresse sans précédent en Iran : les réservoirs d'eau presque à sec
summary: Les quatre barrages alimentant Mashhad, deuxième plus grande ville d'Iran, sont pratiquement à sec avec des réserves à moins de 3%, a rapporté dimanche un média local, au moment où le pays fait face à une sécheresse sans précédent. Hamidreza Azari, ingénieur en recherche à l'Université Aix-Marseille, est notre invité.

title: La dépouille rendue dimanche à Israël identifiée comme celle du soldat Hadar Goldin mort en 2014
summary: L’armée israélienne a annoncé dimanche que le Hamas avait remis à la Croix-Rouge dans la bande de Gaza un cercueil contenant le corps d’un otage. Celui-ci a été identifié par les autorités israéliennes comme Hadar Goldin, un soldat tué en 2014, comme l'avait annoncé plus tôt le mouvement palestinien.

title: Le quotidien à Gaza après deux ans de frappes meurtrières menées par Israël
summary: Les dernières images de Gaza en ruines après deux ans de frappes meurtrières menées par Israël.

title: Au Liban, au moins trois morts et plusieurs blessés dans de nouvelles frappes israéliennes
summary: Selon le ministère libanais de la Santé, des frappes israéliennes ont tué samedi trois personnes et fait plusieurs blessés. L'armée israélienne a pour sa part confirmé avoir tué deux personnes présentées comme des "terroristes".

title: Sécheresse inédite en Iran : le gouvernement prévoit des coupures d'eau
summary: Le gouvernement iranien prévoit de couper périodiquement l'eau à Téhéran, métropole de plus de 10 millions d'habitants, afin de limiter la consommation et d'enrayer le "gaspillage", au moment où l'Iran fait face à une sécheresse sans précédent.

title: Sécheresse inédite en Iran : "on craint le pire pour les prochains mois"
summary: L'Iran est confronté cette année à sa pire sécheresse depuis des décennies. À Téhéran, le gouvernement prévoit des coupures pour économiser l'eau. Le président iranien a averti jeudi que Téhéran pourrait devoir être évacuée en raison des pénuries d'eau s'il ne pleut pas d'ici la fin de l'année. Les explications de notre correspondant Siavosh Ghazi à Téhéran.

title: Gaza : les étudiants gazaouis de l'Université Al-Aqsa diplomés malgré les bombes
summary: Malgré la précarité de la trêve et les conditions de vie extrêmement difficiles à Gaza, une promotion d’étudiants palestiniens a été diplômée à l'Université Al-Aqsa.

title: Gaza : le corps remis vendredi à Israël identifié comme celui d'un otage israélo-argentin
summary: L'armée israélienne a annoncé samedi que la dépouille remise la veille par le Hamas et le Jihad islamique à Gaza était celle de Lior Rudaeff, un Israélo-Argentin tué et enlevé le 7 octobre 2023. Chauffeur d'ambulance bénévole, il avait tenté de défendre son kibboutz avec quatre autres habitants lors de l'attaque du Hamas.

title: Libération de Cécile Kohler et Jacques Paris : diplomatie ou chantage ?
summary: Clément Therme, chercheur associé à l'Institut français des relations internationales et spécialiste du monde iranien, est notre invité.

title: L'armée israélienne annonce que la Croix-Rouge a réceptionné la dépouille d'un otage à Gaza
summary: Un des derniers corps d'otages encore retenus à Gaza a été réceptionné par la Croix-Rouge à l'État hébreu dans la soirée, a annoncé vendredi l'armée israélienne. Sur les 28 personnes concernées, 22 dépouilles ont été rendues à Israël. Les six dernières sont celles de cinq Israéliens et d'un Thaïlandais.

title: EN DIRECT, Gaza : les Emirats arabes unis disent qu’ils ne participeront « probablement pas » à une force internationale de stabilisation
summary: Cette force est prévue dans l’accord qui a conduit à un cessez-le-feu le 10 octobre. Selon les termes de cet accord, il s’agira d’une coalition en majorité composée de pays arabes et musulmans, et déployée pour superviser la sécurité à mesure que l’armée israélienne se retirera. La porte-parole du gouvernement israélien a, par ailleurs, dit qu’« il n’y aura pas de soldats turcs sur le terrain ».

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : Kiev affirme avoir subi 74 attaques dans la nuit ; sept missiles et 67 drones comptabilisés
summary: « Quinze drones d’attaque ont été enregistrés comme ayant touché neuf sites », a précisé l’armée de l’air ukrainienne, ajoutant qu’« aucune donnée sur des chutes ou impacts n’a été reçue » pour le moment.

title: En Equateur, des violences dans une prison font 31 morts
summary: Après que des affrontements à l’arme à feu et à l’explosif ont fait quatre morts dans la nuit de samedi à dimanche à Machala, les autorités ont annoncé que 27 morts supplémentaires, pour beaucoup « asphyxiés », avaient été découverts.

title: A Memphis, la peur et la colère des quartiers populaires, après le déploiement de forces fédérales
summary: Laboratoire de la politique sécuritaire de Donald Trump, la ville du Tennessee vit depuis un mois sous le déploiement massif de forces fédérales et de la garde nationale. Tandis que la Maison Blanche se félicite de centaines d’arrestations, les habitants des quartiers noirs et latinos dénoncent une militarisation sans précédent, nourrie par la xénophobie.

title: Les Philippines frappées par un nouveau typhon, trois jours après le passage meurtrier de Kalmaegi
summary: Le « supertyphon » Fung-Wong a provoqué des rafales atteignant jusqu’à 275 km/h, interrompant les opérations de secours sur l’île de Cebu dévastée par le précédent cyclone tropical, qui a fait 224 morts dans le pays.

title: Les « sentiments mêlés » des soldats ukrainiens face aux scénarios de cessez-le-feu
summary: Alors que la possibilité d’une trêve sur le champ de bataille a resurgi ces derniers mois avec le retour de Donald Trump à la Maison Blanche, peu de combattants croient en un retour à la maison prochainement.

title: Shutdown aux Etats-Unis : les démocrates se divisent au Sénat, ouvrant la voie à une sortie de la paralysie budgétaire
summary: Après quarante jours de shutdown, huit sénateurs de l’opposition ont cédé, dimanche, et uni leurs voix à celles des républicains sur un texte devant mettre fin au blocage de l’Etat fédéral. Un choix décrié dans leur camp en raison de la faiblesse des concessions obtenues.

title: En Israël, les impensés de l’après-guerre
summary: A l’approche des élections législatives de 2026, la société israélienne va devoir affronter ses divisions entre une extrême droite de plus en plus sécuritaire et une gauche tentée par l’émigration.

title: « L’invalidation des droits de douane de Donald Trump constituerait une leçon magistrale : la primauté du droit sur la loi de la jungle »
summary: La Cour suprême des Etats-Unis a jeté de gros doutes sur la légalité de la mesure la plus emblématique du président américain. Les pays qui ont cédé à son chantage n’ont-ils pas confondu vitesse et précipitation ?, s’interroge, dans sa chronique, Stéphane Lauer, éditorialiste au « Monde ».

title: Une sortie de shutdown se dessine aux Etats-Unis après un accord au Sénat entre démocrates et républicains
summary: Le pays est, depuis le 1ᵉʳ octobre, en situation de paralysie budgétaire, ce qui a provoqué la fermeture de plusieurs services de l’Etat fédéral. Le texte, qui ne fait pas l’unanimité chez les démocrates, doit encore passer devant la Chambre des représentants, avant d’être soumis à Donald Trump pour signature.

title: Le tigre et la pie, de la mythologie coréenne aux écrans de Netflix
summary: Le succès du film d’animation américain « K-Pop Demon Hunters » ravive l’intérêt des Sud-Coréens pour le « hojakdo », un genre traditionnel mettant en scène des tigres et des pies. Expositions, événements culturels ou créations culinaires jouent de la popularité du tigre Derpy et de la pie Suzy, personnages du film.

title: Au Royaume-Uni, la BBC fragilisée après la démission de son directeur à la suite de coupes jugées « biaisées » dans un discours de Donald Trump
summary: Tim Davie, le directeur général du groupe audiovisuel britannique, et Deborah Turness, à la tête de BBC News, ont annoncé leur départ dimanche, après les révélations du « Daily Telegraph » mettant en évidence un montage des propos du président américain dans un documentaire consacré à l’assaut du Capitole, en 2021.

title: Cair condemns Israeli settler attack on Palestinians, journalists in West Bank
summary:
Cair condemns Israeli settler attack on Palestinians, journalists in West Bank

The Council on American-Islamic Relations (Cair) on Monday condemned the attack by Israeli settlers on Palestinian villagers, activists and journalists during the olive harvest in the occupied West Bank.

Settlers reportedly used sticks, clubs and stones against Palestinians harvesting olives, in which a Reuters news agency photographer and security adviser were wounded. 

Cair called on the US government to renew sanctions earlier this month, warning that unchecked settler violence continues to endanger Palestinians and those documenting the effects of the Israeli occupation of Palestinian territory.

title: Illegal Israeli settlers attack journalists in occupied West Bank, injuries reported
summary:
Illegal Israeli settlers attack journalists in occupied West Bank, injuries reported

Photojournalist Raneen Sawafta on Monday said settlers attacked journalists covering the olive harvest in the occupied West Bank, Reuters news agency reported. 

“We were running away and the terrain was mountainous. I was wearing the press vest and they were hitting me in the parts that were not covered by the vest,” she said.

The attack took place near the Palestinian village of Beita, where settlers armed with sticks, clubs and rocks targeted villagers, activists and reporters.

Two Reuters employees, a journalist and a security adviser, were among those injured, the report said. 

Al Jazeera cameraman Loay al-Saeed described being chased by masked men.

title: UAE will not join international stabilisation force in Gaza
summary:
UAE will not join international stabilisation force in Gaza

The United Arab Emirates will not join the international stabilisation force for Gaza because it lacks a clear framework, APF reported on Monday citing a senior official. 

"The UAE does not yet see a clear framework for the stability force, and under such circumstances will probably not participate in such a force," presidential advisor Anwar Gargash told a forum in Abu Dhabi.

title: Israeli army continues demolition of residential buildings in Khan Younis
summary:
Israeli army continues demolition of residential buildings in Khan Younis

The Israeli army on Monday carried out demolition and explosion operations on residential buildings in the eastern areas of Khan Younis city, South of the Strip, Al Jazeera Arabic reported. 

Israeli demolition operations, which have been noticeably increasing in pace and intensity recently, target every two-storey building or house, according to Engineer Hamdan Radwan, mayor of Bani Suheila in eastern Khan Younis.

title: Israeli army announces military exercise along Jordan border
summary:
Israeli army announces military exercise along Jordan border

The Israeli army on Sunday announced that it will begin extensive military exercises across the West Bank and the Jordan Valley, along the border with Jordan, starting Monday morning. 

In a statement on Telegram, the army said the exercise will include intensive movement of troops and military vehicles in the areas.

title: Israeli drone attack targets car in southern Lebanon, local media reports
summary:
Israeli drone attack targets car in southern Lebanon, local media reports

An Israeli drone attack on Monday targeted a car near al-Bisariya in southern Lebanon, Lebanon’s state-run National News Agency reported.

Despite a ceasefire that came into force in November last year, Israel continues to carry out near-daily strikes in southern Lebanon. At least four people were killed over the weekend in separate Israeli drone strikes in southern Lebanon.

On 30 October, Lebanese President Joseph Aoun instructed the commander of the army to "confront any Israeli incursion into southern Lebanon", after Israeli forces crossed the border, entered a municipal building in the southern town of Blida and killed an employee. 

Lebanese Prime Minister Nawaf Salam condemned the incident, calling it “a blatant attack on the institutions and sovereignty of the Lebanese state”.

title: Knesset to vote on bill to impose death penalty on Palestinian prisoners
summary:
Knesset to vote on bill to impose death penalty on Palestinian prisoners

The Knesset on Monday will vote in the first reading on a bill to impose the death penalty on Palestinian prisoners, Israel Hayom reported. 

The legislation, championed by far-right National Security Minister Itamar Ben-Gvir, was pushed through the Knesset’s National Security Committee on 3 November, drawing widespread condemnation from human rights groups.

If passed, the law would allow Israeli courts to impose the death penalty on Palestinians convicted of killing Israelis on "nationalistic grounds".

The legislation does not apply to Israelis who kill Palestinians under similar circumstances.

title: Legal team presents new evidence of torture of Palestinian prisoners to ICC
summary:
Legal team presents new evidence of torture of Palestinian prisoners to ICC

New evidence regarding the torture of Palestinian prisoners whose mutilated bodies were returned by Israel was presented at the International Criminal Court by a legal team representing the victims of the genocide in Gaza.

Al Jazeera Arabic reported that evidence regarding the targeting of journalists was added to the ongoing series of legal efforts to prosecute Israel in the International Court since 2008.

According to the report, documented medical evidence was presented by doctors and forensic experts through detailed reports, photos, videos, and family testimonies.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning,

We are on day 31 after a fragile ceasefire was agreed upon to end Israel's two-year genocidal war on Gaza. The truce has been violated by Israel many times as it launches new operations and continues to strike Gaza, while settlers displace Palestinians from the West Bank. 

Here are the major developments from the last few hours: 

  • Israeli military has announced that it will begin large-scale military exercises throughout the West Bank and the Palestinian Jordan Valley on the border with Jordan.

  • In his second visit in three weeks, US envoy Jared Kushner arrived in Israel to follow up on Trump's plan for a ceasefire in the Gaza Strip.

  • Israeli warplanes targeted the eastern areas of Gaza City early Monday morning. 

  • A Palestinian man was wounded after being assaulted by Israeli soldiers at the Al-Zaim checkpoint, east of occupied Jerusalem.

  • Israeli forces stormed the town of Al-Ubaidiya, east of Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank, launched raids and arrested several citizens.

  • Israeli Broadcasting Authority has reported that Americans are pressuring Israel to begin implementing the second phase of Trump's ceasefire plan.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • Israeli forces arrested 442 Palestinians, including 33 children, in October, according to a joint statement by the four rights groups.

  • The Israeli Prime Minister’s Office confirms that the remains of a captive’s body received from Hamas belong to Israeli soldier Hadar Goldin.

  • A fifth Palestine Action-affiliated prisoner has launched a hunger strike over her detention conditions and the UK government's ban on the direct action group.

  • Turkey is working to ensure the safe passage of some 200 civilians trapped in tunnels in Gaza, after having facilitated the return of a deceased Israeli soldier killed there more than a decade ago, a senior Turkish official said.

  • The Palestinian health ministry said that Israeli strikes in Gaza have killed one person and injured five others in the past 24 hours. 

  • Israeli settlers have started setting up a new outpost in the town of Anata, east of occupied East Jerusalem, the Bedouin rights group Al-Baidar reported.

  • One person was killed in the earlier Israeli attack on south Lebanon, Al Jazeera reported, citing the Health Emergency Operations Centre of the Lebanese Ministry of Public Health.

  • An Israeli military court postponed proceedings in the case of a 16-year-old Palestinian-American detained without trial in a notorious Israeli prison to 15 December, effectively extending his imprisonment at least until then, NPR reported.

  • The former Israeli military lawyer who stepped down after confirming her involvement in leaking footage showing soldiers abusing a Palestinian prisoner inside the Sde Teiman detention camp attempted suicide this morning, said the police commissioner.

title: Former Israeli prosecutor investigated for video leak attempts suicide, says police commissioner
summary:
Former Israeli prosecutor investigated for video leak attempts suicide, says police commissioner

The former Israeli military lawyer, Yifat Tomer-Yerushalmi, who stepped down after confirming her involvement in leaking footage showing soldiers abusing a Palestinian prisoner inside the notorious Sde Teiman detention camp, attempted suicide this morning, Police Commissioner Chief Superintendent Danny Levi says.

In the footage, heavily armed Israeli soldiers can be seen grabbing and leading away a blindfolded Palestinian prisoner before surrounding him with riot shields to obscure their gang rape.

The Palestinian man, who, according to some reports, has since been sent back to Gaza, suffered an injury to his anus, a ruptured bowel, lung damage, and broken ribs.

Netanyahu described the leak as the most “severe public relations attack” on Israel.

title: UK: Fifth Palestine Action prisoner joins rolling hunger strike over detention conditions
summary:
UK: Fifth Palestine Action prisoner joins rolling hunger strike over detention conditions

A fifth Palestine Action-affiliated prisoner has launched a hunger strike over her detention conditions and the UK government's ban on the direct action group.

The 29-year-old prisoner, named T Hoxha, has joined four other prisoners in a rolling hunger strike launched on 2 November over what they describe as "systematic abuse" by the prison authorities.

Qesser Zurah and Amu Gibb, prisoners currently held at HMP Bronzefield, launched their strikes on Sunday. Heba Muraisi, who is held at HMP New Hall, joined on Monday, and Jon Cink, also held at Bronzefield, refused food on Thursday.

Hoxha is one of the "Filton 24" - activists from the recently proscribed direct action group Palestine Action who were arrested on terrorism charges.

Read more: UK: Fifth Palestine Action prisoner joins rolling hunger strike over detention conditions

Pro-Palestinian, anti-Israel protesters caused chaos at the show on Thursday night, repeatedly interrupting it with flares, lighting chair on fire

Former US ambassador to Israel says most of the 'adverse attention' paid to Israeli-founded firm is unfair, will pitch it to Trump administration as way to 'make Americans safer'

title: Iranian athletes win three bronze medals at Islamic Solidarity Games in Riyadh
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iranian athletes secured three bronze medals in judo, boxing, and swimming at the ongoing Islamic Solidarity Games in Riyadh, marking the country’s first achievements in the multi-sport event.

title: Iran and Oman seek to expand marine and health tourism
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran’s Minister of Cultural Heritage, Tourism, and Handicrafts Reza Salehi-Amiri, and his Omani counterpart, Salem bin Mohammed Al Mahrouqi have talked about strengthening bilateral cooperation in various fields of tourism between the two neighboring countries.

title: Iran’s tourism minister meets UN Tourism Sec-Gen
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Minister of Cultural Heritage, Tourism, and Handicrafts Reza Salehi-Amiri has met with Zurab Pololikashvili, the Secretary-General of the UN Tourism, in Riyadh.

title: Caspian Sea governors’ summit in Iran key to enhancing regional cooperation: Deputy FM
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Deputy Foreign Minister for Legal and International Affairs Kazem Gharibabadi has described the International Conference of Governors of the Caspian Sea Littoral States in the Iranian province of Gilan as an important step in strengthening regional cooperation.

title: Iranian swimmer wins first gold medal in Islamic Solidarity Games
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iranian athlete Amirhossein Abdoli has secured the gold medal in the men’s 50-meter freestyle event at the sixth edition of the Islamic Solidarity Games in Riyadh.

title: Third day of ‘Riyadh 2025’ competitions
summary: The third day of the 2025 Islamic Solidarity Games were held in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia’s capital, on November 9, featuring judo competitions in both men’s and women’s categories. Iranian athletes took part in the competitions as well.

title: Salehi Amiri: A new chapter opens in tourism ties between Tehran and Yerevan
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Minister of Cultural Heritage, Tourism, and Handicrafts Reza Salehi Amiri has announced the beginning of a new chapter in tourism relations between Tehran and Yerevan and emphasized the need to develop automobile tourism, cultural exchanges and the formation of a joint committee to follow up on the agreed resolutions.

title: Salehi Amiri: China is Iran’s strategic partner in tourism
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Minister of Cultural Heritage, Tourism, and Handicrafts Reza Salehi Amiri has stressed that developing cultural interactions and attracting a share of China's huge tourism market is one of the main priorities of Iran's tourism policy.

title: US pressure will not hinder Iran-China cooperation: Chinese ambassador
summary: Astara, IRNA – China’s ambassador to Iran says Beijing and Tehran will continue their cooperation despite US provocations and unilateral sanctions against Iran.

title: Iran never turned away from diplomatic engagement: Deputy FM
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Saeed Khatibzadeh, Deputy Foreign Minister and Head of the Center for Political and International Studies (CPIS) at Iran’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs, says the Islamic Republic does not need to prove its good intention as it has never turned away from diplomacy.

title: Iran expresses concern about Afghanistan-Pakistan tensions
summary: Tehran, IRAN – Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi and the foreign minister of Afghanistan’s current ruling government, Amir Khan Muttaqi, have discussed bilateral cooperation and the recent tensions between Islamabad and Kabul.

title: Turnout in Iraq’s special parliamentary vote reaches 60%
summary: Baghdad, IRNA – About 60% of eligible voters took part in Iraq’s special voting for security forces and displaced persons in the country’s sixth parliamentary election, the Independent High Electoral Commission said on Sunday.

title: Iranian leaders have never been hostile to West
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 10 (MNA) – Ali Larijani, the Secretary of Iran’s Supreme National Security Council, emphasized that the country's leaders have never harbored hostility toward the West.

title: "No deviation from peaceful nuclear path"
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 10 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Ministry Spokesman says Iran’s nuclear program is entirely peaceful, and there is no evidence or indication that it has deviated from this path.”

title: Iran, Oman seek to expand ties in marine, cultural tourism
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 10 (MNA) – The Iranian and Omani ministers exchanged views on enhancing joint initiatives in marine and cultural tourism, reflecting the growing ties between the two neighboring nations.

title: Iranian vocalist Ali Karimi Tarki appointed as Arirang Master
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 10 (MNA) – Ali Karimi Tarki, a distinguished practitioner of Iranian classical vocal music, was officially appointed as Arirang Master No. 25001101 for the second half of 2025.

title: Khazineh Valley, Marvel of Nature in Iran's Lorestan (+VIDEO)
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 10 (MNA) – Khazineh Valley is midway on the Pol Dokhtar to Andimeshk Road, in western Iran, next to a village by the same name. It has undergone erosion with the passage of time and taken its current shape after many peaks and troughs.

title: Iran launches Tourist Card to boost foreign visitors security
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 10 (MNA) – Iran’s Minister of Cultural Heritage, Tourism, and Handicrafts announced that the new “Tourist Card” scheme, now operational at airports, will enhance the safety of foreign tourists while easing currency exchange and payments.

title: How Cyrus the Great built world’s first multicultural empire
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 10 (MNA) – Centuries before modern nations began defining human rights, Cyrus the Great laid out principles of freedom, dignity, and cultural respect that still feel revolutionary today.

title: US Senate to vote on bill to end shutdown within hours
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 10 (MNA) – The United States Senate is holding a vote to advance a Republican stopgap funding package that could pave the way to end the longest government shutdown in the country’s history.

title: 7 more Palestinians killed as Israel continues Gaza strikes
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 10 (MNA) – Palestinian media report that seven more Palestinians have been killed in the past 24 hours amid ongoing Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip, despite the declared ceasefire.

title: Front pages of Iran's English dailies on November 10
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 10 (MNA) – Here are the front pages of Iran's English language dailies on Monday, November 10.

title: Iran’s Abdoli makes history with swimming gold at ISG
summary: TEHRAN, Nov. 09 (MNA) – Iranian swimmer Amirhossein Abdoli made history on Sunday night by clinching Iran’s first-ever gold medal in swimming at the Islamic Solidarity Games.

title: Iran never turned away from diplomatic engagement: Deputy FM
summary: Saeed Khatibzadeh, Deputy Iranian foreign minister Saeid Khatibzadeh has said that the Islamic Republic does not need to prove its good intentions as it has never turned away from diplomacy.

title: راهی که ادامه دارد
summary: ساری - دل‌های نوجوانان امروز با قهرمانان واقعی دفاع مقدس در شلمچه گره خورده است و راه این نام‌آوران ادامه دارد.

title: ضرورت نقش‌آفرینی هیئت‌های مذهبی در عرصه خدمات اجتماعی
summary: بیرجند- مدیرکل تبلیغات اسلامی خراسان جنوبی گفت: هیئت‌های مذهبی باید به نقش‌آفرینی در عرصه خدمات اجتماعی بیش از گذشته توجه داشته باشند.

title: قلندری:۵ میلیارد تومان برای احیا وبازسازی سرای حاج احمد اختصاص یافت
summary: اردبیل-فرماندار اردبیل گفت: ۵۰ میلیارد تومان برای احیا وبازسازی سرای حاج احمد اردبیل اختصاص می یابد.

title: آمادگی سازمان غذا و دارو برای توسعه همکاری های آزمایشگاهی
summary: مدیرکل آزمایشگاه‌های مرجع سازمان غذا و دارو، از آمادگی توسعه همکاری‌ها با بخش خصوصی، دانشگاه‌ها و آزمایشگاه‌های استانی، در راستای ارتقای شبکه ملی کنترل کیفیت محصولات سلامت محور خبر داد.

title: جباری:مرمت و ساماندهی سرای حاج احمد بازار تاریخی اردبیل ضرورت دارد
summary: اردبیل-مدیرکل میراث‌فرهنگی، گردشگری و صنایع‌دستی استان اردبیل گفت: سرای حاج احمد در بازار تاریخی اردبیل از نظر استحکام بنا در شرایط مناسبی قرار ندارد و مرمت و ساماندهی این سرا ضروری است.

title: کدام استان ها بدترین نرخ فرزندآوری را دارند + فیلم
summary: رئیس اداره جوانی جمعیت وزارت بهداشت، به استان هایی اشاره کرد که به رغم برخوردار بودن، اما بدترین نرخ فرزندآوری را دارند.
